document.masterDocTitle: Aquatic Coleoptera (Dryopidae, Dytiscidae, Elmidae, Gyrinidae, Haliplidae, Helophoridae, Hydrochidae, Hydrophilidae, Noteridae, Psephenidae) of Iowa: Distributional Records and Notes

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Aquatic Coleoptera (Dryopidae, Dytiscidae, Elmidae, Gyrinidae, Haliplidae, Helophoridae, Hydrochidae, Hydrophilidae, Noteridae, Psephenidae) of Iowa: Distributional Records and Notes

subSubSection.paragraph:
Acilius fraternus (Harris)
. Clinton:
Brophy Cr., McCausland, CTH, 8/11/04; Hardin: Private Wetland, Buckeye, MTF, 8/14/07; Jackson: South Big Mill Cr., Bellevue, CTH, 9/3/10; Lee: Bonnell Cr., Franklin, CTH, 7/16/02; Wayne: East Fk. Medicine Cr., Allerton, CTH, 8/11/05. Distribution: Eastern USA , extending west to Iowa in the north and Texas in the south. Iowa forms the northwestern border in the USA . Beyond the single wetland collection, stream habitats varied from small and intermittent to a wider, slow-moving stream.

Acilius mediatus (Say)
. Appanoose:
Little Shoal Cr., Cincinnati, CTH, 10/4/11; Davis : Fox R., Moulton, CTH, 6/29/06;
Delaware :
puddle at Ram Hollow Spring, Colesburg, CTH, 10/16/00; Johnson: Iowa City ( Wickham 1911 ) Lucas: Whitebreast Cr., Woodburn, KLS, 9/24/02; Ringgold : Gooseberry Cr., Mt.Ayr, TMM, 7/2/ 03;
Van Buren:
Town Branch, Pittsburg, CTH,
9/14/15. Distribution: Eastern USA , extending
west to Minnesota in the north, Nebraska , and Mississippi in the south. Collection habitats consisted of smaller, slow flowing streams, and from a puddle.

Acilus semisulcatus Aubé. Cerro Gordo
:
Union Hills West Wetland , Thornton MTF, 7/20/07; Hancock: Pilot Knob Wetland, Forest City, MTF, 7/18/07; Winnebago : Private Wetland, Forest City, MTF, 7/18/07; Winneshiek: UV light, KR, 11/3/01;
Worth :
Pilot Knob Wetland , Lake Mills , MTF, 7/18/07. Distribution : Northern transcontinental in the USA . Iowa forms the southern border in the Midwest. Its habitat preference is lentic environments
.

Acilus sylvanus Hilsenhoff. Black Hawk
:
Dry Run Cr., Cedar Falls, CTH, 8/29/11; Buchanan: Bear Cr., Brandon, TFW, 8/8/96; Jackson: South Big Mill Cr., Bellevue, CTH, 9/17/14; Poweshiek: Walnut Cr., Brooklyn, CTH, 7/28/09; Winneshiek: Trout R., Decorah, CTH, 7/18/07. Distribution: Northeastern USA , with Iowa forming part of the southwestern border. Habitat preferences are generally standing waters, although all collections recorded in Iowa occurred in small to midsized streams.

Agabus aeruginosus Aubé. Johnson
:
Iowa City ( Wickham 1911 ). Distribution: Northeastern USA , with
Iowa forming part of the northwestern border.

Agabus ambiguus (Say)
. Emmet:
Ditch 151, Wallingford, JML, 6/17/03. Distribution: Northern transcontinental in the USA . Iowa forms the southern border in the Midwest.Habitat preference for this species is depositional environments in lotic systems, generally small streams, springs, and stream fed ponds.

Agabus antennatus Leech. Hamilton
:
Little Wall Lake, PJS (National Museum of Natural History), 6/14/52. Distribution: Northwestern USA , with Iowa forming part of the southeastern border.

Agabus anthracinus Mannerheim.
(
Larson et al. 2000
)
. Distribution: Northern transcontinental in the USA , with Iowa forming the southern border in the Midwest.

Agabus bifarius (Kirby)
. Johnson:
( Wickham 1911 ). Distribution: northern transcontinental in the USA with Iowa forming part of the southern border in the Midwest.

Agabus disintegratus (Crotch)
. Kossuth:
Private Wetland, Bancroft, MTF, 6/13/07; Pottawattamie: ( Wickham 1911 ) Sioux: Deep Cr., Granville, KLS,

8/2/06; Union: Sand Cr., Arispe, JML, 6/11/03. Distribution: Transcontinental in the USA . Its habitat preference is temporary ponds. However, collection sites include two streams, one intermittent, and one drainage ditch flowing through an agricultural field.

Agabus punctatus Melsheimer. Story
:
Ames ( Wickham 1911 ). Distribution: Eastern USA , with Iowa forming part of the western border.

Agabus subfuscatus Sharp.
A
specimen is in the National Museum of Natural History and has no data on the collection label beyond IA (
Larson et al. 2000
). Distribution: Northeastern USA , extending west to Iowa .

Boreonectes griseostriatus (De Geer)
. Hamilton:
White Fox Cr., Webster City, CTH, 8/25/97; Johnson: ( Wickham 1911 ); Kossuth: Buffalo Cr., Michaelson, JML, 8/24/00. Distribution: Northern transcontinental in the USA , with Iowa forming the southern border in the Midwest. Its habitat preference is mineral substrate in disturbed, or erosive, environments.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Upper Iowa R . ( UV light), MJH , 6/18/12. Distribution : Primarily eastern USA , extending from Massachusetts in the north to Florida in the south and west to Texas in the south and Minnesota in the north. Iowa forms part of the western border of its distribution.
New state record

North Liberty ( UV light), MHB, 7/31/13. Distribution : Primarily eastern USA , extending west to Texas in the south and Iowa in the north.
New state record

subSubSection.paragraph:
Coelambus dissimilis (Gemminger and Harold)
. Allamakee:
Yellow R., Postville, CTH, 7/24/12; Clinton: Silver Cr., DeWitt, CTH, 7/21/98; Dubuque: Cloie Branch, Durango, CTH, 8/5/ 14; Hancock: Unnamed trib. East Branch of Iowa R., Goodell, TMM, 6/26/13; Johnson: Iowa City ( Wickham 1911 ); Linn: Behrens Pond (UV light), DAV, 3/6/04; Story: Ames ( Wickham 1911 ). Distribution: Northern transcontinental in the USA , with Iowa forming part of the southern border. This species’ habitat preference is shallow, often temporary ponds and marshes. The Iowa stream collection sites were small flowing streams with coarse substrate and sand mix.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Deer Cr. , Carpenter , CTH , 8/25/08. Distribution : Northeastern USA . Iowa forms part of southwestern edge of the species’ distribution. Its habitat preference is small, but permanent, ponds, especially among emergent grasses and sedges on the margins. The Iowa collection site is a wooded, cobbled flowing stream, but has areas with slow velocity and aquatic vegetation.
New state record

subSubSection.paragraph:
Coelambus nubilis (LeConte)
.
Grundy :
Middle Fk. South Beaver Cr. , Ackley , CTH
, 8/15/01;
Ida :
Battle Cr. , Holstein , KLS
, 6/29/04;
Iowa :
Matt Foley Wetland , Koszta , DPH
, 5/31/02;
Johnson :
Iowa City ( Wickham 1911 )
;
Worth :
Elk Cr. , Kensett , CTH
,
8/26/08. Distribution : Nearly transcontinental in the USA , except for the extreme West. Its habitat preference tends to be standing bodies of water that are permanent in nature. Several of the Iowa collections were in small streams
.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Cedar Rapids ( UV light), ELF, 9/4/99. Distribution: Northeastern USA , extending west to Minnesota in the north. Iowa forms part of the southwestern border of its distribution. Its habitat preference is marshy areas dominated by
Typha L.
( Typhaceae ) and sedges. New state record

subSubSection.paragraph:
Colymbetes exaratus LeConte. Hardin
:
Private Wetland, Buckeye, MTF, 8/14/07; Story: South Skunk R ., Ames, CTH , 9/18/95. Distribution : Western USA , extending east to Illinois and Wisconsin . Habitat preference is among dense emergent vegetation at the margins of standing waters
.
forms the northern border of its distribution in the Midwest. Its habitat preference is generally lentic with organic debris, but records occurr in flowing streams.

Cybister fimbriolatus (Say)
. Cass:
Indian Cr., Lewis, KLS, 7/23/02; Cerro Gordo: Private Wetland, Clear Lake, MTF, 7/2/08; Greene: Snake Cr., Rippey, MTF, 8/14/07; Humboldt: East Fk. Des Moines R., St. Joseph, TMM, 9/13/ 11; Kossuth: East Fk. Des Moines R., St. Joseph, TMM, 9/16/11; Wright: PBG Control Wetland, Belmond, MTF, 7/15/08. Distribution: Eastern USA , extending west to Texas in the south, Kansas , and North Dakota in the north. Its habitat preference is deeper areas of standing waters.

Desmopachria convexa (Aubé)
. Johnson:
( Wickham 1911 ); Muscatine: Honey Cr., Conesville, CTH, 7/18/06; Story: ( Wickham 1911 ). Distribution: Transcontinental in the USA , except the southwestern states. New state record.

Dytiscus alaskanus Balfour-Browne. Winnebago
:
Private Wetland, Thompson, MTF, 7/18/07. Distribution: Northern transcontinental in the USA , with Iowa forming the southern border in the Midwest. Its habitat preference is generally ponds or lakes. New state record.

Dytiscus circumcinctus Ahrens
(
Larson et al. 2000
)
. Distribution: Northern transcontinental in the USA , with Iowa forming the southern border in the Midwest.

Dytiscus cordieri Aubé. Cerro Gordo
:
Union Hills West Wetland, Thornton, MTF, 7/20/07; Dickinson: Freda Haffner Kettlehole, Milford, MTF, 7/24/07; Winnebago: Private Wetland, Leland, MTF, 7/1/06. Distribution: Northern transcontinental in the USA , with Iowa forming the southern border in the Midwest. Its habitat preference is standing waters, ranging from permanent to temporary bodies.

Dytiscus dauricus Gebler. Cerro Gordo
:
Private Wetland, Clear Lake, MTF, 7/2/08. Distribution: Northern transcontinental in the USA , with Iowa forming the southern border in the Midwest. Its habitat preference is permanent ponds in forested areas as well as beaver ponds. New state record.

Dytiscus fasciventris Say. Greene
:
Snake Cr. , Rippey, MTF, 8/14/07; Winnebago: Private Wetland, Lake Mills , MTF, 7/18/07. Distribution: Northeastern USA , extending west to Minnesota in the north and Iowa . Iowa forms the southwestern edge of the range. Its habitat preference includes ponds and marshes
.

Dytiscus harrisii Kirby.
(
Larson et al. 2000
)
.
Distribution: Northeastern USA , extending west to North Dakota
in the north and Nebraska .

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Little Paint Cr. , Harpers Ferry , CTH , 8/27/14. Distribution : Northeastern USA , extending west to Minnesota in the north and Colorado .
New state record

subSubSection.paragraph:
Eretes explicitus Miller. Fremont
:
Hamburg, Bailey, and Davis, 7/19/36 (Snow Entomology Museum). Distribution: Southcentral USA , extending from Arizona to Texas in the south and north to Iowa , which forms the northeastern border. New state record.

Graphoderus fascicollis (Harris)
. Cerro Gordo:
Union Hills West Wetland
, Thornton , MTF, 7/20/ 07;
Polk :
Grimes , Unknown collector,
7/24/ 1919
. Distribution : Northeastern USA , extending west to Montana in the north, although Iowa forms the southwestern border. Its habitat preference is emergent zones within permanent ponds, usually in areas with deciduous forests
.

Graphoderus liberus (Say)
. Dickinson:
Freda Haffner Kettlehole, Milford, MTF, 7/24/07; Johnson: Ciha Fen, Sutliff, CTH, 4/17/17; Story: ( Wickham 1911 ); Winnebago: Private Wetland, Forest City, MTF, 7/18/07. Distribution: Primarily eastern USA , east of the Great
Plains, although there are Pacific Northwest records. Its habitat preference is boggy ponds and lakes.

Graphoderus manitobensis
Wallis . Hancock:
Private Wetland, Garner, MTF, 7/10/08. Distribution: Northcentral USA, with localized populations only collected from Wisconsin, Minnesota, and Iowa in the USA, thus Iowa forms the southern border. Its habitat preference is large sedge and cattail marshes/ponds.

Graphoderus occidentalis Horn. Dickinson
:
Freda Haffner Kettlehole, Milford, MTF, 7/24/07; Emmet: Private Wetland, Wallingford, MTF, 7/27/07; Hancock: Eagle Lake , Duncan, MTF, 7/ 20/07; Winnebago: Private Wetland, Thompson, MTF, 7/18/07; Wright: Lower Morse Lake , Belmond, MTF, 7/27/07. Distribution: Northwestern USA , extending east to Wisconsin and Illinois . Its habitat preference is open ponds, both permanent and temporary
.

Graphoderus perplexus Sharp. Cerro Gordo
:
Union Hills West Wetland, Thornton, MTF, 7/20/ 07; Davis: Soap Cr., Eldon, CTH, 7/23/02; Dickinson: Jemmerson Slough, Spirit Lake, MTF, 7/24/07; Hancock: Pilot Knob Wetland, Forest City, MTF, 7/18/07; Kossuth: Kettle Wetland-Union Slough NWR, Bancroft, CTH, 5/ 6/97; Mahaska: North Skunk R., CTH, 8/14/02; Winnebago: Private Wetland, Thompson, MTF, 7/18/07. Distribution: Northern transcontinental in the USA . Iowa appears to be the southern edge of its distribution in the Midwest. New state record.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
East Nishnabotna R ., Shenandoah, TMM , 9/18/08. Distribution : Southcentral USA , having been collected from Texas , Oklahoma , and Kansas . Specimens have been collected from grassy vegetation overhanging streams in Texas to temporary ponds in Kansas . Iowa is on the northern edge of its distribution.
New state record

subSubSection.paragraph:
Heterosternuta pulchra (LeConte)
. Clayton:
Peck Cr., Osterdock, CTH, 7/26/11; Dubuque: Catfish Cr., Dubuque, CTH, 8/1/07; Fayette: Deep Cr., Wadena, CTH, 9/28/05; Jackson: Tetes Des Morts Cr., St. Donatus, CTH, 8/27/07; Winneshiek: Ten Mile Cr., Decorah, DPH, 8/23/05. Distribution: Eastern USA , exclusive of the bottom tier of southern states. Iowa is on the northwestern edge of its distribution with collections only from the northeastern quarter of the state. Its habitat preference is the mineral substrates on the margin of streams, as well as lake shores and quarry pools. New state record.

Hydaticus aruspex Clark. Cerro Gordo
:
Private Wetland , Clear Lake , MTF
,
7/2/08;
Dickinson :
Lake Okoboji , LLB – Smithsonian Institute collection,
8/22/1916
;
Emmet :
Drainage Ditch #40, Dolliver , TMM
, 7/30/15; Hancock: Private Wetland, Garner, 7/10/08. Distribution: Transcontinental in the USA , exclusive of the southeastern states. Its habitat preference tends to be larger permanent bodies of standing water with deep detritus and emergent vascular plants.

Hydaticus piceus LeConte. Clay
:
Trumball Lake East, Dickens, MTF, 8/8/07; Johnson: ( Wickham 1911 ); Polk: Grimes, Unknown collector, 7/ 24/1919 ; Story: ( Wickham 1911 ); Winnebago: Pilot Knob Wetland, Forest City, MTF, 8/8/07. Distribution: Northeastern USA , with Iowa forming part of the western border and Missouri
the southwestern edge. Its habitat preference is characterized by woodland pools with emergent aquatic vascular plants and an organic substrate.

Hydrocolus paugus (Fall)
.
(
Larson et al. 2000
). Distribution: Northern transcontinental in the USA , with Iowa forming the southern border in the Midwest.

Hydrocolus stagnalis (Gemminger and Harold)
. Johnson:
( Wickham 1911 ); Story: ( Wickham 1911 ). Distribution: Northeastern USA , with Iowa forming the southwestern border.

Hydroporus dichrous Melsheimer. Hardin
:
Middle Fk. South Beaver Cr., Ackley, CTH, 8/ 14/01; Louisa: Honey Cr., Conesville, CTH, 8/ 24/04; Muscatine: Pike Run, Nichols, CTH, 8/1/ 16. Distribution: Northeastern USA with Iowa forming part of the western border and Missouri the southwestern edge. Its habitat preference is the margin of small ponds and very slow streams with abundant vegetation and detritus.

Hydroporus niger Say. Guthrie
:
Unnamed trib. Middle Raccoon R., Panora, TMM, 8/5/13; Johnson: ( Wickham 1911 ); Muscatine: Pike Run, Nichols, CTH, 8/20/12; Scott: ( Wickham 1911 ). Distribution: Eastern USA , extending west to South Dakota in the north, Nebraska , Kansas , and Texas in the south. Its habitat preference is emergent vegetation in ponds, or slow flowing streams.

Hydroporus notabilis LeConte.
(
Larson et al. 2000
)
.
Clayton :
Mill Cr. , Osterdock , CTH , 9/6/ 11. Distribution : Northern transcontinental in the USA , with Iowa forming the southern border in the Midwest
.

Hydroporus signatus Mannerheim. Linn
:
Rock Island Preserve (UV light), DAV, 3/13/07. Distribution: Transcontinental in the USA , exclusive of southwestern states. Its habitat preference is small mineral substrate pools and vegetated peat land pools. New state record.

Hydrovatus pustulatus (Melsheimer)
. Allamakee:
Hecker Cr., Postville, CTH, 8/14/00; Clinton: Brophy Cr., McCausland, CTH, 8/14/12; Mahaska: Buck Cr., Barnes City, CTH, 7/26/ 12; Muscatine: Pike Run, West Liberty, CTH, 7/19/06. Distribution: Eastern USA , extending west to North Dakota in the north and Texas in the south. Its habitat preference is among vegetation and debris in shallow areas of warm ponds, although the Iowa records were from smaller streams. New state record.

Larson et al. 2000
). Distribution: Central USA ,
although records extend west to Montana and Oregon .

Hygrotus impressopunctatus (Schaller)
. Winneshiek:
UV light, KR, 11/3/01; (
Larson et al. 2000
). Distribution: Transcontinental in the USA , except the southeastern states.

Hygrotus patruelis (LeConte)
.
(Downie and Arnett 1996;
Larson et al. 2000
).
Distribution: Western USA , extending east to Wisconsin and Illinois
.

South Branch Salt Cr., Clutier, CTH, 8/7/14;
Van

Buren: Coppers Cr., Keosauqua, CTH, 6/7/11; Winneshiek: East Pine Cr., Burr Oak, MWB, 9/ 29/08; Woodbury: Rock Cr., Anthon, TMM, 6/ 25/13. Distribution: Transcontinental in the USA , exclusive of extreme south-central and southeastern states. Its habitat preference is flowing water, usually springs and small creeks.

Ilybius incarinatus Zimmermann.
(
Larson et al. 2000
)
.
Distribution: Northeastern USA , extending west to Minnesota and Iowa . Iowa forms the southwestern border of the range
.

Ilybius pleuriticus LeConte. Harrison
:
( Wickham 1911 ); Johnson: ( Wickham 1911 ); Story: ( Wickham 1911 ). Distribution: Northern transcontinental in the USA , with Iowa forming part of the southern border in the Midwest.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Skunk R ., Oakland Mills, MWB, 9/24/08; Johnson: Iowa R ., Iowa City, CTH , 8/8/05. Distribution : Eastern USA . Iowa is on the western edge of its distribution. Its habitat preference is relatively deep water, with many records from clear water pools or ponds with sandy substrates. Within Iowa , collection records were from larger, predominantly finer substrate rivers.
New state record

subSubSection.paragraph:
Liodessus obscurellus (LeConte)
.
(
Larson et al. 2000
).
Distribution: Western USA , extending east to Wisconsin in the north, Indiana , and Louisiana in the south
.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
West Fk. Cedar R ., Finchford , MWB, 8/6/12. Distribution : Eastern USA . Specimens have only been collected in the northeastern quarter of the state from two locations in the same county. Iowa forms part of the northwestern edge of its distribution. Its habitat preference is the margin and undercuts of small, clear streams, although the Iowa collection locations are sandy, mediumsized rivers.
New state record

subSubSection.paragraph:
Matus ovatus Leech. Johnson
:
Iowa City , HFW,
7/ 28/1898
. Distribution : Eastern USA , extending west to
Wisconsin in the north, Iowa , and Texas in the south.

Neoporus hybridus (Aubé)
. Des Moines:
Brush Cr., Burlington, CTH, 9/29/00; Louisa: Iowa R., Wapello, CTH, 9/24/08; Scott: ( Wickham 1911 ). Distribution: Eastern USA , with Iowa forming the northwestern border.

Neoporus superioris (Balfour-Browne)
. Allamakee:
Yellow R., Ion, CTH, 9/14/04; Winnebago: Beaver Cr., Lake Mills, CTH, 7/22/03. Distribution: Northcentral USA , with Iowa forming part of the southern edge of its distribution. Its habitat preference is permanent warm water in slow moving streams and impoundments on streams. New state record.

paragraph.materialsCitation: Little Turkey R ., Protivin, CTH , 8/19/02. Distribution: Northeastern USA, extending west to Iowa, Missouri , and Kansas . Its habitat preference is small to medium creeks in silty, backwater areas. New state record

subSubSection.paragraph:
Neoporus venustus (LeConte)
.
(Downie and Arnett 1996). Distribution: Eastern USA , with Iowa forming part of the western border.

Platambus obtusatus (Say)
. Johnson:
Iowa City ( Wickham 1911 ); (Downie and Arnett 1996). Distribution: Eastern USA , with Iowa forming part of the western border.

Rhantus calidus (Fabricius)
. Johnson:
North Liberty, MHB, 7/14/15. Distribution: Southeastern USA , with Iowa forming the northwestern border. New state record.

Rhantus consimilis Motschulsky. Cerro Gordo
:
Private Wetland, Clear Lake, MTF, 7/2/08. Distribution: Northern transcontinental in the USA . Iowa forms part of the southern border in the Midwest. Its habitat preference is warm, weedy, temporary or permanent ponds, generally in open grassland areas. New state record.

Rhantus gutticollis (Say)
. Allamakee:
French Cr, Churchtown, CTH, 9/16/04; Cerro Gordo: Private Wetland, Clear Lake, MTF, 7/2/08; Clayton: Mill Cr., Osterdock, CTH, 9/6/11; Jackson: South Big Mill Cr., Bellevue, CTH, 8/28/07; Winneshiek: UV light, KR, 11/3/01; Woodbury: Dutch Cr., Danbury, TMM, 6/20/16. Distribution: Western USA , extending to the Midwest. Iowa forms part of the eastern border of its range. Its habitat preference is quiet areas of small, clear streams. New state record.

Rhantus sericans Sharp. Cerro Gordo
:
Union Hills West Wetland , Thornton, MTF, 7/20/07; Dickinson: Private Wetland, Spirit Lake , MTF, 7/24/07; Hancock: Eagle Lake , Duncan, MTF, 7/ 20/07. Distribution: Western USA , extending to the Midwest. Wisconsin , Iowa , and Missouri form part of the eastern border. Its habitat preference is lentic systems, but with a preference for rich, open, sun-warmed ponds
.

Rhantus wallisi Hatch.
(
Larson et al. 2000
)
. Distribution: Northern transcontinental in the USA , with Iowa forming part of the southern border in the Midwest.

Kossuth: Stork Ditch-Union Slough NWR, Bancroft, CTH, 7/22/97; Winneshiek: Trout R., Decorah, CTH,
7/18/07; Wright: Buttermilk Cr. , Goldfield, JML, 9/5/07. Distribution: Scattered throughout the USA , with records from Indiana , Michigan , Utah , and Wisconsin . Its habitat preference is cold stenothermal springs. In Iowa , it has been collected from predicted habitat, as well as waterways supplied by tile-drained land. New state record
.

Thermonectus basillaris (Harris)
. Appanoose:
Little Shoal Cr. , Cincinnati , CTH
,
10/4/11;
Clinton :
Brophy Cr. , McCausland , CTH
,
8/14/ 12;
Montgomery :
East Nishnabotna R
.,
Red Oak , TMM
,
10/12/07. Scott: Brophy Cr. , McCausalnd, MWB, 8/14/12. Distribution: Eastern, extending west to Wisconsin in the north, Iowa, Missouri , and Texas in the south. Its habitat preference is clear, temporary ponds, although the records from Iowa include a large, sandy river, a sandy drainage ditch, and an intermittent gravel/sand stream. New state record
.

Uvarus granarius (Aubé)
. Davis:
North Fabius R ., Moulton , CTH , 7/17/06;
Johnson :
( Wickham 1911 );
Muscatine :
Pike Run , Nichols , CTH , 8/1/ 16. Distribution : Eastern USA , extending west to Minnesota in the north, Iowa , and Texas in the south. Iowa forms part of the western border of the range. Its habitat preference is shallow, sunwarmed shorelines of small pools, although in Iowa the Davis County collection record is from a small intermittent, sandy-bottomed stream
.
preference is small, muddy/clay bottomed pools and shallow, sun-warmed margins of larger water bodies. In Iowa , as reported for Wisconsin , records were from margins of streams.
